page.title: 02LIVING IN SHREWLEY 1985
page.content:
I'm a Commuter. I drive to work in a petrol fueled motor car each day. I come home to my peaceful house in the country.On Saturdays I work in the garden.Sundays are often for visiting mother-in-law.I like to spend some eve- nings at the local pub.The mortgage accounts for nearly half of all I earn.
I'm unemployed. I live about 2 miles from Mr Commuter.No job means no money. The Government pay me some but I have no car. My house is a Council property which I rent.I have to be very careful how much I spend if I go to the pub.I will never get a job.
I'm a farmer. Enforced reductions in milk quotas by the EEC has forced some of my friends to sell land or buildings However harvests are good.
